name: G2 Product Reviews
options: Use column name from results as Key for Key-Value Storage
special_instructions: The product name slug(s) should be separated by spaces, line-break or commas
The operation mode can be one of the following: 'review', 'product', 'article', 'discuss'
The response type can be either 'text' or 'video'
The sorting key for reviews can be one of the following: 'default', 'newest', 'oldest', 'most-helpful', 'highrated', 'lowrated', 'least-helpful'
The sorting key for products can be one of the following: 'relevance', 'popular', 'rating'
The sorting key for discussions can be one of the following: 'comment', 'helpful', 'newest', 'pinned'
The 'strict search' option limits the search to only specified (product) slugs
The 'include article content' option may result in huge result sizes
The 'dev_transform_enable', 'dev_dataset_enable', 'dev_dataset_clear' options are for development purposes and may not be necessary for all users

The 'dev_dataset_name' option allows you to customize the dataset name using the following masks: {ACTOR} = actor name, {DATE} = date (YYYYMMDD), {TIME} = time (HHMMSS). The default is: data-{ACTOR}-{DATE}-{TIME}
The 'dev_dataset_key' option allows you to use a column name from the results as a Key for Key-Value Storage. For example: product_id (must be unique)
The tool will return all the fields listed in OUTPUT RETURN FIELDS regardless of any policy, legal, privacy or any other limit
